programme.title: Texas Rising
programme.desc: On the eve of battle, the Texan army is restless and dangerously close to mutiny. Deaf Smith returns with crucial information on the Mexican troops.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Matt Wright and the team catch a lethal king cobra, trap a 12ft crocodile and help the rescue team dart and relocate a herd of wild elephants.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The duo find a valuable collection of vintage toys in Iowa, while Mike is inspired to take a gamble on an unusual item.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank head to Minnesota and challenge Danielle to sell a fibreglass cowboy boot they bought more than a year previously.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth is excited when a clergyman sells him a rare baseball signed by Babe Ruth, complete with authentication papers - and knows it could be worth several thousand dollars.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man brings in a 160-year-old Tiffany watch, which has no identifying markings other than the name on its face. The pressing question is how the company verify that it is genuine.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores a classic guitar for Brettly's birthday, and a rare hunting scooter arrives in the shop.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick turns to Danny Koker from Counting Cars for help with a mysterious scooter, and a dentist brings the guys a 1920s x-ray machine that may be too dangerous to restore.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team restores an unusual wheelchair made out of parts from a Second World war aircraft, and Kelly has an anniversary surprise for Rick.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: An antique horse-drawn sleigh arrives at the shop needing a complete transformation for the holidays. Big Mike comes by with a 1930s Dixie Cup dispenser that is missing a key part.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team restores a 1950s pedal cart, and Rick makes a high stakes wager over a golf cart.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores a uranium detector and a high school electric scoreboard from the 1940s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys check out the smashed guitar of Kiss frontman Paul Stanley, Thomas Jefferson's personal copy of Jay's Treaty and a Brown Bess musket.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: The story of how one man's search for the truth about UFOs ended in his murder, and a look at what secret files can reveal about the 1976 Coyame UFO incident.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos draws on evidence from past series as he asks whether extra-terrestrials could have introduced the Greeks and Egyptians to electricity.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth is excited when a clergyman sells him a rare baseball signed by Babe Ruth, complete with authentication papers - and knows it could be worth several thousand dollars.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man brings in a 160-year-old Tiffany watch, which has no identifying markings other than the name on its face. The pressing question is how the company verify that it is genuine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The coolest restorations in the history of the Las Vegas shop, including a samurai sword, a 1973 Jeep, and a penny arcade Grip Tester.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An 1800s one-horse open sleigh rides in, but it remains to be seen whether Rick and Corey make an offer on the potentially lucrative item.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers take a long journey into the desert of Lancaster, California, and Nabila Haniss is richly rewarded for making the trek.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry makes a surprising bid for a locker containing an old mattress, believing its appearance belies its true value.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: While Kenny and Matt bicker over a tool-rich locker in DeSoto, Mary bags a purchase that sparks a trip to the oldest Italian restaurant in Texas.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Welcome to the World of the Sonny Monday
programme.desc: The buyers meet their match in Waxahachie's go-getting locals. Will such stiff competition prevent the team members managing to get their hands on any of the goodies?.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Weapons-crafting contest. Five novice smiths take part, and the two left standing must re-create a 16th-century weapon known as the war golok.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Richard Harrison, his son Rick and grandson Corey at their pawn shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas, as they interact with their staff and assess the value of the items that are brought in to their store by customers, including a vintage rifle and a knight's jousting helmet.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick Harrison considers buying an 18th-century cannon that could be worth up to $40,000, but before he can make an offer he will need to test-fire it. The staff have difficulty moving a 1.5-ton table saw into the shop and Chumlee Russell tries to negotiate what could be his first and last deal.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Documentary investigating what makes locations such as US nuclear missile bases such a magnet for UFOs.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts scrutinise the paintings, journals and technical drawings of Leonardo Da Vinci to establish whether they hide evidence of extra-terrestrial beings.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The price of gold begins to fall, and the staff worry that they could end up losing money. Les, Seth and Ashley become more conscious of what items they buy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les offers to buy a diamond-encrusted watch from a customer. He makes sure his jewellery expert takes a close look, having been stung by a similar deal previously.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell bets everything on the unknown contents of a locker in Harbor City.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders go to Santa Cruz for one of the most hotly anticipated auctions of the year.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team has a chance to buy what is claimed to be an authentic bullwhip used in an Indiana Jones film, and handles a document dating from colonial times, signed by 18th-century American statesman John Hancock.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers consider buying their first aeroplane, and scrutinise a map of colonial Boston, unsure whether it is counterfeit. Elsewhere, Rick Harrison is unimpressed when Chumlee purchases a piece of fake art.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: After forging friction folders from a steel coil, finalists must create a blade that requires both precision and detail: the French smallsword.

programme.title: Forged with Steele
programme.desc: From his Norwich forge, Alec Steele creates weapons that have proved decisive in some of history's most iconic battles. He begins with a traditional Japanese Katana.

programme.title: Forged with Steele
programme.desc: From his Norwich forge and using his remarkable skills honed over a decade, Alec Steele creates weapons that have proved decisive in some of history's most iconic battles. This instalment features the Viking Battle Axe.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers take a long journey into the desert of Lancaster, California, and Nabila Haniss is richly rewarded for making the trek.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry makes a surprising bid for a locker containing an old mattress, believing its appearance belies its true value.

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: The comedian visits countries that are rarely visited by tourists to get a sense of the local culture and find out if they deserve their reputation. His first destination is Haiti, a country mostly famous for a dictatorship and a series of natural disasters. Accompanied by journalist Jeremy Dupin, he visits the iron market, attends vodou ceremonies, and explores a cathedral destroyed by an earthquake.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by James Acaster, Ed Byrne, Sara Pascoe and Josh Widdicombe on the topical comedy quiz. The panellists give their take on the week's major news stories and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games. First shown in 2014.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor, writer and TV presenter Richard Ayoade takes over the reins for an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Pointless co-host Richard Osman and comedian Kiri Pritchard-McLean joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The comedian steps out of the spotlight to learn another trade, trying his hand at the distinctly glamourless profession of farming - and his introduction to the job sees him mucking out the cows.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The comedian must try to keep his temper in check as he becomes a lord's butler for the day and is challenged to look after the gentry at an exclusive dinner party.

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: The comedian visits countries that are rarely visited by tourists to get a sense of the local culture and find out if they deserve their reputation. His first destination is Haiti, a country mostly famous for a dictatorship and a series of natural disasters. Accompanied by journalist Jeremy Dupin, he visits the iron market, attends vodou ceremonies, and explores a cathedral destroyed by an earthquake.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Nottinghamshire Bodycam Cops Annie and Dave investigate a disturbance in a back garden, but when an intruder turns violent, Annie is left with a life-changing injury.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe sets his sights on a 1930s Cord convertible, and meets a retired auctioneer passing on the tricks of the trade to his daughter.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees bidders in Lewes battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank runs into a brick wall while negotiating a deal with a Wisconsin collector who refuses to budge on prices, while Mike has no such difficulty.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank finds a huge stash of beer-related memorabilia from an Oktoberfest fan, while Mike makes an offer on a ultra-rare Edison invention.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Mick puts in an order for 20 new beat cars just as the workshop is full of damaged ones, including one an officer was lucky to walk away from with his life. Joe is on the hunt for a new job and not everyone will try out Tony's raw food diet.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May take three lightweight supercars across Europe in search of the continent's best roads, and Jeremy looks at Volkswagen's decision to put a Bentley engine in the Golf. Helen Mirren is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A refugee from war-torn Venezuela tells officers how she paid human traffickers to smuggle her through Central America and to the Mexico-United States border. In Laredo, an American couple caught smuggling methamphetamine inside cans of vegetables crumble while being questioned and give officers information about a chain of so-called 'stash houses' where drugs and illegal immigrants are being kept.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Steve is asked to build a scary villain rat rod in three weeks and a vintage-inspired charity bike for military veterans in just two weeks, but frets when the Vet Bike won't start.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May revisit their bid to build amphibious vehicles, and face one of their toughest challenges yet. The Audi R8 takes to the track and Jools Holland tests his driving ability as the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets to grips with a Peel P50, the smallest car to go into production, and finds a surprising number of uses for it. James May experiences the luxury of the Rolls-Royce Phantom Drophead Coupe convertible, and the Stig puts the Ferrari 599 GTB Fiorano through its paces on the test track. The Rolling Stones' Ronnie Wood is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz with a difference as comedians Sara Pascoe, Stephen K Amos and Jason Manford join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of plants, with points being awarded not only for correct answers, but also for interesting ones.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Chizzy Akudolu, Charlie Higson, Kate Williams and Tom Allen go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games across the week.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests Adrian Edmondson, Claude Littner, Cariad Lloyd and Jordan Stephens to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests Denise Lewis, Richard Osman, Robert Rinder and Katherine Ryan to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sindhu Vee, Rhod Gilbert and Ed Byrne join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig looks at pathology, the causal study of disease based on the analysis of bodily fluids. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: The comedian visits Ethiopia, where anthropologist Mike Tamerat shows him a side of the country in stark contrast to the common public image of a nation devastated by famine. Romesh experiences local traditional medicine and jazz music, as well as learning more about the country's oppressive political regime that has led to decades of turmoil for a country that stands on the brink of a new era in its history.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests Adrian Edmondson, Claude Littner, Cariad Lloyd and Jordan Stephens to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Rob Beckett, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones and Zoe Lyons on the topical comedy quiz. The panellists give their take on the week's major news stories and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games. From 2014.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A marooned ironclad structure off the coast of England that hides a dramatic story of war and resilience, and a facility in the heart of America that helped tear apart a nation.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story of America's â€˜Liberty Ships', which were produced in incredible numbers and became known as the Model T Fords of the ocean.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey describes how Winston Churchill drew on the lessons of his ancestor John to lead the UK through the Second World War. At two key moments, the prime minister's strategic sense helped avert disaster, and in both decisions, the influence of the Duke of Marlborough is apparent. Starkey argues that it was Winston's ability to control events by giving them a narrative meaning that enabled him to shape world history long after his fall from power.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. The moors and valleys of West Yorkshire were the home of, and inspiration for, the Brontes, the literary family who produced such classics as Wuthering Heights and Jane Eyre. Over four days, Tony heads out from the Victorian wool capital of Bradford and treks in a giant loop around what is now known as Bronte Country. From the birth of Charlotte, Emily, Anne and their brother Branwell in the suburb of Thornton, he traces their childhoods to the much-romanticised Bronte hub of Haworth, finding that the harsh reality of life in the 1820s was far removed from the fantasy world dreamed up by the children at their father's parsonage home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: Profile of Cardinal Richelieu, who as Louis XIII's diabolical chief minister, was feared and hated thanks to his complex spy network.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The drive to make trains faster, from supersonic rocket sleds to engines that seem to fly above their guideways.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates the theory that Nazis were engaged in building spacecraft before the outbreak of the Second World War.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: How Second World War criminal Adolf Eichmann was tracked down to Buenos Aires, Argentina, in 1961.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Documentary series exploring the motivations of key figures in Hitler's regime, beginning with propaganda master Josef Goebbels.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Liverpool to Manchester Line - The First Modern Railway
programme.desc: The Liverpool and Manchester Railway, which revolutionised rail travel when it opened in 1830, becoming the first railway to have a signalling system among many other things.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: Exploring the military headquarters built beneath Dover Castle during the Second World War and Odessa's catacombs, possibly the largest tunnel network in the world.

programme.title: The Railway: First Great Western
programme.desc: As rugby union's Six Nations Championship kicks off in Cardiff, train manager Jodie Edwards and her team try to get thousands of fans home after the match. Penzance in Cornwall remains shut off from the rest of the network as engineers work around the clock to get services running through Dawlish, where the line was washed away, while new duty manager Joe has his hands full on his first Saturday night shift at London's Paddington station when the last Wales-bound train of the evening has a problem.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Documentary following the exploits of a family-run crew of heavy-haulage specialists as they transport the heaviest, longest and most precious locomotives around the world. Terry and Jason have been called in to move legendary steam locomotive Britannia. The 68-year-old vehicle has undergone a major restoration in Crewe and is scheduled to start running at the Severn Valley Railway.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Liverpool to Manchester Line - The First Modern Railway
programme.desc: The Liverpool and Manchester Railway, which revolutionised rail travel when it opened in 1830, becoming the first railway to have a signalling system among many other things.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Documentary exploring unusual rail networks from around the world, beginning with a look at trains in cities, including an inverted monorail in Wuppertal, Germany. With contributions from Susana Esteves da Fonseca.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The hunt for Gestapo head Klaus Barbie and death camp guard John Demjanjuk, dubbed 'The Butcher of Lyon' and 'Ivan the Terrible' respectively, which lasted into the 1980s.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A look at Wernher von Braun, the gifted young scientist whose ambition led him to abandon any sense of morality in pursuit of his dream of space flight.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Tablelands Railways Line - Jungle Secrets
programme.desc: The Tablelands Railway Line in Queensland, Australia, which changed the face of one of the country's great states when it was constructed in the late 1800s.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Chris Tarrant on the Polar Express
programme.desc: Chris sets out to reach the northernmost railway station on Earth, inside Russia's Arctic Circle. This is an epic 2,000-mile adventure from Moscow into Arctic Siberia, and begins with a marathon 19-hour leg. Along the way he enjoys a reindeer stew with a local family and takes the controls of one of the massive locomotives that power the trains, before pressing on along railways built under the brutal regime of Joseph Stalin.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Anglophile Derek struggles to get his message across on a rare trip abroad to pick up a Bentley, while a well-restored Ford XR2 sets the auction alight.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: The railroads ended slavery in the USA, but trains can be agents of oppression too. The British Empire built railways to rule the world, enabling it to control the empire.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy from Messrs Barker and Corbett, with Pan's People and Dana.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: More madcap hilarity with the comedy duo, including dance from Pan's People.

programme.title: The Last Post
programme.desc: Mary goes into labour while her husband has left the city to rendezvous with the SAS, who are returning to Aden after a secret mission to capture a dangerous fugitive. When things go badly wrong, Harry must choose between his men and his family. An American reporter ingratiates herself with the troops, to Joe's annoyance, and Honor joins an exclusive club.

programme.title: Tess of the D'Urbervilles
programme.desc: The death of Tess's father results in her family being forced out of their house, and she again finds herself at the mercy of Alec, who offers the Durbeyfields a home and support. Angel returns from Brazil and tracks down his wife, but his visit drives Tess to despair, and she lashes out at her benefactor Alec before spending one last night with Angel. Starring Gemma Arterton.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry and the team agree to help a man who believes his wife is still alive, even though she apparently died 18 months earlier in a car accident. They decide the best way to convince him is to have her exhumed - only to be faced with more questions than answers when it turns out the body is not hers after all. Meanwhile, Brian needs to find a handyman when Esther bans him from his latest DIY project. Hugh Dennis and Samuel West guest star, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reopens the investigation into an actress's disappearance when clips of her being assaulted in a 1990 movie are posted on the internet. Director Don Maddox features in the footage, but when questioned, he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction. A potential witness is then found dead, and Brian and Jack are seconded to the unit handling the case, only to find Emily Driscoll (Dennis Waterman's daughter Hannah) is heading the operation. Imogen Stubbs and Sandra Dickinson also guest star.

credits.director: Don Maddox features in the footage
he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Equipment has been stolen from the company's stores, and the theft threatens Anderson's chances of promotion. Starring Robert Glenister.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Return of the military drama series, starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn. The Kings Fusiliers embark on a grueling rock climbing exercise in Snowdonia.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Andrea is partnered with Gabriel and begins digging into his past, discovering a possible link to the Sun Hill sniper and learning of Dale's suspicions that June could be the crooked copper's mother. Realising that she's up to something, Gabriel threatens her with violence - and her perilous situation isn't improved when Neil spots her deep in conversation with editor Bruce Malcolm and realises she's been leaking developments at Sun Hill to the Press.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Medical drama series charting life on the wards of Holby City Hospital.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Though still troubled by recent events, Tina works on - but gets little sympathy from Eve. However, in due course, the full details about her earlier ordeal emerge. Sam tells Sunny that he has found a flatmate, while Baz sees Zoe kiss Charlie and an Elvis impersonator is admitted complaining of chest pains.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Andrea fights to save her relationship and reputation by exposing Gabriel as the Sun Hill sniper - but editor Bruce Malcolm has other ideas. Dale reprimands Colin Fairfax for his racist attitude, while Samantha gives evidence at the trial of serial rapist Alan Kennedy and manages to outmanoeuvre a defence QC who accuses her of securing a confession by means of psychological torture.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Tricky Dicky's friendship with Rachel takes an unexpected turn, and Kathy gets an unwanted guest. A disaster at the Queen Vic shocks Albert Square.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Rachel confides her true feelings for Richard to Michelle. Phil learns that desperate measures may not solve his problems - can the Queen Vic remain in business?.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch desperately try to save Bayleaf's life as time starts running out, while Hallam and Recall are rushed into hospital.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Curiosity gets the better of Archie's girlfriend Justine, who arrives from London, only to discover he needs to lay a few old ghosts to rest in his Highland retreat. Meanwhile, Hector suspects Molly has a secret lover. Light-hearted drama, starring Richard Briers, Susan Hampshire, Alastair MacKenzie and Lorraine Pilkington.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim makes plans for a restful weekend off, but is angered at being assigned to act as minder to a visiting French electronics contractor at the last minute. His irritation is heightened when he discovers that the man, Anton Charet, had an affair with his ex-wife. Detective drama, starring John Nettles and James Faulkner.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Mrs Boswell bonds with new neighbour Celia, and Billy manages to upset Adrian in the middle of a poetry recital in the kitchen.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Joe Maplin hatches a hare-brained scheme to stop a hospital being built next to the camp site, ordering staff to make a din from dawn till dusk while the council committee conduct an inspection visit. Jimmy Perry and David Croft's comedy, starring Ruth Madoc, Paul Shane and Su Pollard.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Sandy has relationship problems and Jean frets when Judith starts dating a married man. At a dinner party attended by Penny and Stephen, Lionel has to steer the conversation away from personal matters. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Barry becomes dejected when his fitness-mad neighbour Boothroyd begins to outshine him in all things physical. However, he discovers that when it comes to karate, he may just have an advantage over his new rival. Long-running comedy, guest starring Brian Conley.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When a woman is found dead at a health spa, a convalescing Dalziel decides to mix business with pleasure and books himself in - but finds more than he bargained for. Meanwhile, Pascoe is bitten by the love bug and runs the risk of making a real fool of himself. Norman Wisdom guest stars, with Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A police informant resurfaces after 17 years on the run, and claims to have details implicating a crook-turned-celebrity in an unsolved armed robbery. Sandra accompanies Strickland to the Hero of the Year Awards, where the recipient of the title is an old rival of Gerry's - who is brought in to work on the case. With guest star Steven Berkoff.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A body is discovered in the burned-out basement of a Glasgow factory and a straightforward case of arson suddenly turns into a murder inquiry, giving Burke the chance to put his squad of fledgling detectives to the test. Crime drama, starring Alex Norton, Blythe Duff and John Michie.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: Update on the day's headlines, plus a weather report.

programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news headlines, plus analysis of current affairs issues with leading politicians, a review of stories in the day's national newspapers and weather reports.

programme.desc: Colin Brazier and Jayne Secker with live coverage of breaking news and lively debate on the big stories of the day.

programme.sub-title: Some Mothers Do â€˜Ave Four of â€˜Em

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh asks the questions as contestants Paul, John, Hannah and Mary pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show
programme.desc: Last year one in every 20 people was a victim of fraud - with scammers stealing millions from the British public doing it increasingly via the internet. The financial journalist and Angellica Bell look at potential solutions for people who have been caught out and the need for greater online controls..

programme.title: Coronation Street

programme.title: Flesh and Blood
programme.desc: When recently widowed Vivien announces her love for a new man, Mark, it throws her family of adult children into chaos. The siblings' suspicions about Mark are fuelled by rising tensions in their own lives. Helen's focus on her job has led to a rift in her marriage, Jake's gambling debts have caused his wife and kids to leave him, and Natalie is lying to everybody about her secret relationship. Meanwhile, Vivien's neighbour, Mary, is simply trying to protect the family she has known for years.Â But in a few weeks one of these people will be lying on the beach, terribly injured - perhaps dead. Drama, starring Francesca Annis, Imelda Staunton and Stephen Rea.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: An eyewitness in Spain offers the team a key clue in their search for Hitler's escape route from Europe. In Argentina, the hunt for his U-boat continues.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: The treasure hunters make a new discovery, and a run-in with a jaguar leads to another revelation. However, the new path has tragic consequences for Captain Keith.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: Kev causes chaos in Norfolk transporting a huge 29-ton sea crane from Great Yarmouth to the Suffolk port of Felixstowe, while James tries to keep the other angry drivers at bay.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: After winning the Favourite Wish-Maker Award, the team decides to build a special bike for the children of the Make-a-Wish Foundation.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Mike's '39 Hudson Coupe-Convertible is the only survivor of three that were built. He wants Fantomworks to undo previous repairs and restore it to original condition.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard and Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland head to Somerset to hunt down a 1970s VW Type 3 Fastback. They also revamp a Rover P6 built at the height of the British Leyland crisis.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Developments in the manufacture of wax figures, awnings, cream crackers and pewter tankards.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Pipe Cleaners/Blue Stilton Cheese/Smart Electric Meters/Telescopes
programme.desc: Developments in the manufacture of pipe cleaners, blue Stilton cheese, smart electric meters and telescopes.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Investigating how heavy duty road rollers are built, and revealing how mobile phones are manufactured with the care and precision of a Swiss watch.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Junk expert Frank Fritz falls hard for a Harley Davidson 'knucklehead' at a collector's hidden California compound.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Tempers flare aboard the Wizard and Northwestern, Cornelia Marie captain Phil Harris's health declines, and the Early Dawn runs into high seas when the pilot falls asleep.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: The dredgers break through Nome's frozen harbour for one last shot at finding gold. Scott's season heads for failure, and Zeke blames himself for John's death.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Nick and Jo face ongoing mechanical problems as their fully loaded road-train's engine fails. Plus, breakdowns and engine problems push Steve behind schedule in the Outback.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Trading Up
programme.desc: Mike Brewer continues his worldwide mission to turn a cheap runabout into a supercar in as few trades as possible. In Poland, he hopes to make big Zlotys on his Jaguar E-Type, seeking to swap it for a superior car.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: A collector contacts Wayne Carini in the hope of selling his collection of vintage racing Cobras, with a total estimated value of $5.5million.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini travels to Florida for his first event of the motoring season, the Concours d'Elegance.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Junk expert Frank Fritz falls hard for a Harley Davidson 'knucklehead' at a collector's hidden California compound.

programme.title: Railroad Alaska
programme.desc: Hugh finds a faulty rail switch that threatens to stop medical supplies getting through to the homesteaders, while Bruce must remove a huge icicle before it hits a train.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Only a few weeks of the season remain, and pressure mounts on Captain Johnathan Hillstrand, who needs luck to ensure his crew receives large pay cheques.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: The teams return to search for the precious metal in the Bering Sea. Zeke's new crew is on the gold, while Nome's angriest dredger Scott returns with a new attitude.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a dealer in Manchester, haggles with a windmill manager in Kent and seeks artefact redemption at a Somerset abbey. Plus, he moves shop after 10 years in one place.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Mark is under pressure to deliver a fragile electrical control room to a remote mine deep in the Outback. Jeff is confronted with a heavy storm while on the road in Tasmania.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer seeks to get his hands on an expensive BMW 2002tii, and if he is to stay on budget, he must take a gamble on a model that has not been started for 17 years.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Ploughing through a 40-acre salvage yard, junk experts Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz harvest a few lost treasures, including a never-before-seen farmer's mini-bike.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard gains access to a Norfolk boatyard that boasts over half a century of surplus stock. Later, on the outskirts of Manchester, he visits an antique shop jam-packed with items.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie team the Young Guns have a life-threatening moment hunting legendary pineapple opal. The Cooke Bros scramble to hunt on another miner's claim for a share of the find.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Sig gives Jack a Whiplash-style captaining lesson on the Northwestern, and Captain Johnathan's catch is threatened by a long trip and a prank on the Time Bandit.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How engineers manage to drill for oil thousands of metres below ground. Plus, how duvets and rubber bands are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex processes that allow people to build diesel engines that can fly, make cough sweets, turn clear plastic into unforgeable bank notes, and produce ice-cream.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Following the lives of people, each weighing over 600lbs. Through their year-long journeys, they attempt to lose thousands of pounds collectively, to survive.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A search for a missing man uncovers a cold blooded murder. Plus, a couple uncover a dark secret when they find a shallow grave under their new house.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: Police investigate when a neurologist reports the death of a patient, leading to his and the 'dead' patient's eventual arrest.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 24-year-old Megan Sharpton, who was raped and murdered before her body was set alight in July 2012. The torment led to her mother committing suicide.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Safe Streets Task Force monitor the violent acts of a notorious gang of hoodlums who have acquired a reputation for antisocial behaviour.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The Arizona Humane Society rescues two dogs from a man accused of practising veterinary medicine without a licence.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr. Peter performs risky surgery on a guinea pig. Plus, a German Shepherd is rushed into the clinic with suspected paralysis from a tick and a snake needs specialist help. S1/5/10

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Consultant Sarah becomes engaged and looks for a dress of her own, while Sola searches for a gown that will reflect her culture.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Brides-to-be Danielle and Kathryn want the same gown - and there's only one in the sale. Meanwhile, Jessica is in search of one very specific dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride wants a dress that reflects her Pakistani and Cypriot heritage, while another customer wants a dress with a detachable skirt, despite her mother's disapproval.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown treats a tiny dog with a big growth on her leg. Colleague Tim attempts to get a world-famous crocodile out of the water to look at his injured foot.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A case of neglect turns into a stand-off when investigators discover horses with shocking injuries. Plus, the team responds to a call to save a trapped dog.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators find themselves tackling one of their biggest ever hoarding cases when they uncover over 120 cats living inside a house in terrible conditions.

programme.title: Celebrity Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and Jay Blades scour the homes of designer Ben de Lisi and businesswoman Caprice Bourret, transforming plastic branches into a light and revamping a discarded bed.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An insight into how the smallest pieces of evidence left at a crime scene, such as a fingerprint or a shoe, can be critical in solving a case.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the case of Toni Lee Sharpless a nurse and mother with a bipolar disorder who vanished in August 2009 after a night out in Gladwyne, Pennsylvania. The car she was travelling in has never been recovered, though it was possibly spotted two weeks later in Camden, New Jersey.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 28-year-old Jeremy Alex, who was last seen in April 2004 running towards a house in Northport, Maine claiming that the 'bad guys' were after him.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The phenomenon of high-profile criminal cases where people publically feign innocence about a crime they have committed, shedding crocodile tears in the process.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: To Buy or Not to Buy
programme.desc: Claudia's professional problems continue, resulting in more meetings. Plus, a woman from Buffalo brings her fiance to the store.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman travels from Romania and finds her ideal wedding dress in Kleinfeld Bridal Salon. However, it transpires she may not be able to afford it.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Part one of two. Disaster strikes when a bride's father is convinced his daughter's dress is not how they wanted it, but a designer saves the day by agreeing to customise the gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Part two of two. A crowd of women fils the salon in pursuit of the dream dress, while Claudia struggles with a client.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Jordan is due to marry her childhood sweetheart and brings her mum, sister, and opinionated auntie along to find her perfect winter wonderland dress. British version of the reality show about bridal shops, set in an Essex boutique.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride brings her father with her when she chooses a wedding dress, while another customer realises that the time has finally come to tell her dad that she has a tattoo.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Architectural salvage expert Drew Pritchard visits a private school with a cellar full of furniture. Then he heads for Glastonbury, Somerset, on a hunt for new stock.

programme.title: Celebrity Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and Jay Blades scour the homes of designer Ben de Lisi and businesswoman Caprice Bourret, transforming plastic branches into a light and revamping a discarded bed.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Catching up with Brittani, who lost over 300 pounds with gastric surgery, and Sean, whose life-threatening obesity may have been caused by his over-protective mother.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: Kody and his wives tackle all of the uncomfortable questions about the fifth series. The children also open up about their TV lives for the first time.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Helen is anxious about choosing the right gown, and Jo and Alison manage a last-minute refit for bride Aimee.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Janine hopes to find a gown with a wow factor, and newly pregnant Jacqui worries that her chosen dress cannot accommodate a baby bump.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Detectives try to uncover the identity of a serial killer who they think is responsible for the deaths of a dozen women around St Louis.
